attributes.action: Allow Child Trust Funds to be placed in Help to Buy ISA’s for those who are 16ys
attributes.additional_details: The first deposit into a H2B ISA is capped at £1200, then monthly deposits capped at £200 after that. A CTF should be able to be used for this first deposit and any surplus in the CTF placed in a standard junior ISA .
attributes.background:
The deadline to open a H2B ISA is November 30th - you must be 16yrs old to open one.
A 16yr old with a stocks and shares CTF only has the option to secure it in a junior ISA.
I believe they should have the option of placing it in a H2B ISA to give them a head start on buying their first home
